title.narrative: Argentina Rural Education Improvement Project - PROMER

description.narrative: The Project's Development Objective is to support national Government policy to: (i) improve the coverage, efficiency, and qualityof the Argentine education system, and (ii) to improve the governance of the Argentine education system through strengthening of thenormative, planning, information, monitoring, and evaluation capacity at the national and provincial levels.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: A FMR which describes physical progress in Project implementation, both cumulatively and for the period covered by said report,andexplains variances between the actual and planned Project implement.
A FMR which sets forth sources and uses of funds for the Project, both cumulatively and for the period covered showing separatelyfunds provided under the Loan
The Borrower shall enable the Bank#s representatives to examine record such as contracts, orders, invoices, bills, receipts andother documents.
The Borrower shall ensure that statements of expenditure are included in the audit for each fiscal year
The Borrower shall furnish to the Bank not later than six months after the end of each such year (or such other period agreed tobythe Bank: certified copies of the financial statements
The Borrower shall prepare the status of procurement under the Project, as at the end of the period covered by said report.

title.narrative: Reduce by half the number of 6 year old children in 1st grade who did not attend Preschool in rural areas in Argentina.
Number of bilateral agreements between national and provincial Governments in satisfactory execution

actual.value: Target achieved. All 23 agreements have been signed

title.narrative: Number of infrastructure projects completed with PROMER funding
Percentage of rural schools surveyed for the National Educative Map.
Percentage of secondary rural schools that receive ICT equipment as a share of total secondary rural schools participating in school networks
Number of rural schools with at least one teacher graduate from the diploma program in math and Spanish
Percentage of rural schools that receive institutional libraries as a share of rural schools participating in school networks
Increase the access of students completing the 7th grade to the 8th grade of schooling in rural areas in Argentina
Improve promotion rates in grades 1 to 6 in rural areas in Argentina
Increase the access of students completing the 6th grade to the 7th grade of schooling in rural areas in Argentina.
Standardized National Assessment Test (ONE) sample extended and especially designed to assess student learning in grades 3 and in grades 6 in rural schools in 2007, 2010 and 2013.

baseline.value: No standardized national assessment test results for a representative sample in rural areas.

target.value: Test with extended sample conducted in 2013.

comment.narrative: Results from 2010 evaluation partially available. Plans for 2013 underway.

title.narrative: Implementation of a web-based system to access information and results of the rural schools census.
Annual plans regarding the compilation, analysis, dissemination and use of educational statistics in satisfactory execution
